DOC.detailed_description: This randomize , double-blind , multicenter treatment study evaluate efficacy safety high-dose , short-course oral levofloxacin treatment versus treatment oral antibiotic acute bacterial exacerbation chronic bronchitis ( ABECB ) . This study evaluate use high-dose ( 750 milligram ) short-course ( 3 5 day ) levofloxacin compare conventional dos schedule effective antibiotic control acute bacterial infection patient chronic bronchitis , The study divide 700 patient two group -- one group le severe ( uncomplicated ) chronic bronchitis , one severe ( complicate ) chronic bronchitis . Patients uncomplicated disease receive levofloxacin 750 mg daily 3 day azithromycin 250 mg twice day 1 day 250 mg day 4 day . Patients complicate disease receive levofloxacin 750 mg daily 5 day amoxicillin/ clavulanate ( 875/125 mg ) twice daily 10 day . All patient take study medication orally . Effectiveness measure compare patient 's sign symptom present Test-of-Cure Visits ( study day 13 - 22 ) observe Study Entry Visit . Safety evaluate throughout study basis occurrence severity unexpected undesirable event well laboratory test physical examination . The hypothesis study short course ( 3 day ) 750 mg levofloxacin least effective well tolerate azithromycin 5 day uncomplicated ABECB , 750 mg levofloxacin 5 day least effective well tolerate amoxicillin/ clavulanate 10 day cure complicate ABECB case . Uncomplicated ABECB : Oral dos levofloxacin 750 mg daily 3 day , azithromycin 250 mg twice daily day 1 , 250 mg daily day 2 - 5 . Complicated ABECB : Oral dos levofloxacin 750 mg daily 5 day , amoxicillin/clavulante 875/125 mg daily 10 day .
